result.execSummary:
The defendant Jake A. King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jake A. King
parties.address: 208 West Larch Street, Silver Lake, WI 53170

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $200 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.

to defendant that attorney fees determined are $126.00, paid to date is $500.00 leaving $374.00 to be applied to other fine & costs due.
Atty Gregory Bates, advocate counsel, attorney fees $126.00 to be paid by Defendant. Counsel is hereby discharged from this matter.

Atty Gregory Bates, advocate counsel, attorney fees $126.00
1.8 hr
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jake A. King, appeared with Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 60 days in the KCJ with Huber privileges.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 9 months with conditions.  Credit for 8 days if revoked.   As a condition court imposes a fine of $200 plus costs.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied and remaining balance to be paid during probation.  Appeal Rights given.
Atty Gregory Bates @ repayment rate of $20/week commencing on 4/3/15.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Jake A. King, appeared.  Clerk: PT
DE waived his right to an attorney and during plea colloquy he is now requesting an attorney be appointed.  Court appoints Atty Bates as Advocate Counsel for DE.  Status Conf. on 5/6/15 at 10:40 AM.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

2:08 pm    Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk:  LE.  Plea of not guilty entered by the Court.  Plea Hrg on 3-27-15 @ 9:30.  $100 cash bond set with conditions.
$100 posted on 1-7-15
